result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: NO CONTACT with the victim or child.  *March 15, 2017  Amended to change the  Order to:   No violent contact with child.  No contact with victim except that defendant may have third party contact with victim for the purposes of coordinating contact with child.

Decision and Order Granting Request to Modify No Contact Order, received, signed and filed. tk
Therefore, it is hereby Ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to change the order for "NO CONTACT with the victim or child" to "No violent contact with child and no contact with victim except that the defendant may have third-party contact with victim for the purposes of coordinating contact with child". All other sentencing orders shall remain in effect.

Original Transcript SENTENCING (34 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 16, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Katelynn S and Angela U.
AS to count 1:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served.  
AS to count 2:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1.
AS to count 4:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1 and 2.
Court orders the defendant to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges for counts 1,2,4 during term of extended supervision in count 10, non-payment will result in civil judgment.
AS to count 10:   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 45 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 123 days time served, consecutive to counts 1,2,and 4.  CONFINEMENT of 21 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Court orders that all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in counts 1,2,4 be paid during period of Extended Supervison.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-NO CONTACT with victim or child
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Credit; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for jury trial today, but parties have reached a resolution.
Count 4 is ordered amended to CHILD NEGLECT, a class A misdemeanor, 948.12(1)(a)
Defendant will be entering guilty pleas to counts 1, 2, 4(as amended) and 10.  Counts 3, 5 thru 9, and 11 thru 14 are ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS to counts 1, 2, 4 and 10:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant remanded pending sentencing on 9-16-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
ADA Abbey Desiato appeared for the state.  Atty Wineke is not available, on vacation and cannot be reached by phone.  Case to remain on calendar for 8-24-2015.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion To Adjourn received and filed with court.
Filed by the state:  Requsted Jury Instructions; Motion in Limine

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Due to the unavailability of the court on 8-31-2015, the (SPEEDY) Jury Trial rescheduled to Branch 38 on 8-24-2015 at 8:15 am.  mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.   mld

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-31-2015 at 8:15 am.  Offer will remain open until 7-21-2015, per the State.  EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.   mld
This case will be heard in Prelim Court for Branch 4.

Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in custody.  Matthew Torbenson for Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Robert Austin-Greenfield Police Department Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Katelynn S.; MU dob 12/9/14; Mary U. or Jacqueline S

Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 1, 2, 6, 7, 8 & 9.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    
Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
